content: DiveAbled
Providing scuba diving training and specialized equipment for people with disabilities
Custom-fit scuba gear, knowledgeable instructors, accessible facilities, medical support, underwater communication devices
Diveheart, The Handicapped Scuba Association, The WAVES Project, Dive Pirates Foundation, Scuba Rangers
DiveAbled's custom-fit scuba gear and underwater communication devices provide a safer and more enjoyable diving experience for disabled divers.
WheelScuba
Customized scuba diving equipment designed for disabled divers who use wheelchairs
Wheelchair-compatible gear, instructors with disability training, accessible facilities, medical support, underwater communication devices
Diveheart, The Handicapped Scuba Association, The WAVES Project, Dive Pirates Foundation, Scuba Rangers
WheelScuba's specialized equipment is designed specifically for wheelchair users and includes features such as adjustable harnesses and cradles for ease of use.
DiveBuddies
Connecting disabled divers with volunteer scuba diving buddies for assistance and support during dives
Personalized diving assistance, trained volunteers, medical support, accessible facilities, underwater communication devices
Diveheart, The Handicapped Scuba Association, The WAVES Project, Dive Pirates Foundation, Scuba Rangers
DiveBuddies' personalized diving assistance matches divers with trained volunteers who can provide physical assistance and emotional support during dives.
UnderwaterTherapy
Scuba diving therapy sessions for people with disabilities as a form of physical and mental rehabilitation
Experienced therapists, adaptive scuba gear, accessible facilities, underwater communication devices, personalized therapy plans
Diveheart, The Handicapped Scuba Association, The WAVES Project, Dive Pirates Foundation, Scuba Rangers
UnderwaterTherapy's personalized therapy plans use scuba diving as a form of physical and mental rehabilitation, providing a unique and beneficial experience.
pain_point_description: scuba diving offers a unique experience for people with disabilities, but they may face additional challenges with equipment, transportation, and accessibility. creating a service that offers scuba training and specialized diving equipment for disabled people, as well as having knowledgeable and professional staff to guide them, would be a helpful solution for supporting diving for disabled people
